Description: Fragment of neck and shoulder of East Greek pottery closed vase; exterior, dull cream slip (very worn); floral pattern in red-brown fired glaze, volute and loose-leaf palmette with additional added dots; bounding line below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.942)
